intro: Micropholis compta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved micropholis, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango trees. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
